title: Graph of magnetic field between two parallel wires

content.question: Two wires carrying equal currents of magnitude <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> perpendicularly out of the plane of the page are fixed on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis at <math alttext="x equals plus or minus a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>±</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. Which of the following graphs best shows the total magnetic field <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of position on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis between <math alttext="negative a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="positive a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, assuming that the field is positive when in the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> direction?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph in four quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x. The vertical axis is labeled B. Horizontal position plus a is labeled to the right of the vertical axis. Horizontal position negative a is labeled to the left of the vertical axis. Vertical dashed lines extend up and down from positions negative a and positive a. The curve begins in quadrant 2. A curve begins near the top of the dashed line that extends up from negative a. The concave up curve decreases in value with a decreasing slope from just to the right of negative a and intersects above the origin. The concave up curve increases in value from above the origin with an increasing slope until the curve is just to the left and near the top of the vertical dashed line extends up from positive a.

The figure shows a graph in four quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x. The vertical axis is labeled B. Horizontal position plus a is labeled to the right of the vertical axis. Horizontal position negative a is labeled to the left of the vertical axis. Vertical dashed lines extend up and down from positions negative a and positive a. The curve begins in quadrant 2. A curve begins near the top of the dashed line that extends up from negative a. The concave up curve decreases in value with a decreasing slope from just to the right of negative a and intersects the origin. The concave up curve increases in value from the origin with an increasing slope until the curve is just to the left and near the top of the vertical dashed line extends up from positive a.

The figure shows a graph in four quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled x. The vertical axis is labeled B. Horizontal position plus a is labeled to the right of the vertical axis. Horizontal position negative a is labeled to the left of the vertical axis. Vertical dashed lines extend up and down from positions negative a and positive a. The curve begins in quadrant 2. A curve begins near the bottom of the dashed line that extends down from negative a. The concave down curve increases in value with a decreasing slope from just to the right of negative a and intersects halfway above the origin and the top of the vertical axis. The concave down curve decreases in value from halfway above the origin and the top of the vertical axis with an increasing slope until the curve is just to the left and near the bottom of the vertical dashed line extends down from positive a.

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
